Package Singletons

Class InputManager

java.lang.Object
Singletons.InputManager
public class InputManager extends Object
Singleton class to manage user input

      Returns:

    • getUniqueString

      public String getUniqueString(String message, Set<String> existingValues)
      Gets a unique string input from user (Useful for unique usernames, ids, etc.)
      Parameters:
      message - message to display to user
      existingValues - set of existing values to check against
      Returns:
      unique string entered by user

    • getBoolean

      public boolean getBoolean(String message)
      Gets a boolean input from user
      Parameters:
      message - message to display to user
      Returns:
      true if user enters 'Y', false otherwise

    • goBackPrompt

      public int goBackPrompt()
      Prompts user to press enter to go back
      Returns:
      1 to indicate to continue showing the previous menu

      public <E extends Enum<E>> E getEnum(String s, Class<E> enumClass)
      Gets an enum input from user
      Type Parameters:
      E - enum type
      Parameters:
      s - message to display to user
      enumClass - enum class with values to choose from
      Returns:
      enum value selected by user

    • getSelection

      public <T> T getSelection(String s, List<T> list)
      Works just like getSelection(String, List, boolean) but with no option to go back
      See Also:
      • getSelection(String, List, boolean)

    • getSelection

      public <T> SelectionResult<T> getSelection(String s, List<T> list, boolean allowBack)
      Gets a selection from a list of items
      Type Parameters:
      T - type of items in list
      Parameters:
      s - message to display to user
      list - list of items to choose from
      allowBack - whether to allow user to go back
      Returns:
      item selected by user

    • getNewPasswordInput

      public String getNewPasswordInput(boolean passwordValidation)
      Gets a new password input from user Repeatedly asks for password until a valid password is entered Requires confirmation of password
      Parameters:
      passwordValidation - can toggle whether password validation is required (Mainly for testing)
      Returns:
      valid password entered by user

    • validatePassword

      public boolean validatePassword(String password)
      Validate password
      Password must be at least 8 characters long
      Password must contain at least one digit, one lowercase letter, one uppercase letter, and one special character
      Password must not contain spaces
      Password cannot be 'password'
      Parameters:
      password - password to validate
      Returns:
      true if password is valid, false otherwise

    • getPrescription

      public Prescription getPrescription()

    • selectTimeSlot

      public TimeSlotWithDoctor selectTimeSlot(LocalDate date, String patientId)
      Shows a list of available timeslots for the selected date and allows them to select one.
      Parameters:
      date - The date for which to select a timeslot.
      Returns:
      The selected timeslot, or null if the user cancels the selection.
